resources.string: Incorrect phone code format! Please check again.

This is BabyListener. What this app does is that it listens to the surroundings, and if and when there is a loud sound (perhaps baby crying?), it will make a call to the designated phone code. Yes, one application is to set this phone with this app running next to a sleeping baby and run some quick errands.

** PLEASE REMEMBER!!! **
This app is NOT perfect. I claim NO responsibility for any accident while using this app.

You got that?
Caution! The phone is NOT in silent mode.

BabyListener needs Do Not Disturb access because when it\'s in detection mode, it tries to put the phone in SILENT mode, so the baby (perhaps) won\'t be disturbed by a phone ring. By clicking OK, the screen will switch to a different screen where you can turn on Do Not Disturb access.\n\nProceed?
You can change the access status later by manually selecting the link in \"Setting\" menu.
Send SMS to the designated code when detection has ended unexpectedly.\n(Ex. has been paused too long)
This app needs \"Do Not Disturb\" access to silence the phone when in detect mode.\nTouch to switch the screen.
Send SMS with the specified command code to place a call to the SMS sender.
Notify every detection pause and resume event to designated code.

string-array.name: pref_sure_to_disable_warning_titles
string-array.item: Are you sure?
Are you REALLY sure?
Are you 100% sure?
Think Hard
Think REALLY Hard
Think very carefully
I\'m concerned
I\'m seriously concerned
Please reconsider
Truthfully
From now on

string-array.name: pref_sure_to_disable_warning_msgs
string-array.item: Do you REALLY want to disable the Warning?
Do you REALLY REALLY REALLY want to disable the Warning?
I mean, are you absolutely 100% sure that you want to disable the Warning?
This feature is really good. Don\'t you want it?
What if it\'s off, and you don\'t know about it, it could be problematic. Are you sure to turn off this?
You may think the detector is running well, but what if it\'s off? To imagine this... Still want it off?
App isn\'t always perfect. It never runs as well as the developer has thought through. Are you going to trust this imperfect being?
Thank you for trusting the developer, but I\'m not a god. You wouldn\'t turn this off, would you?
I\'m starting to doubt your motive on insisting to turn off this feature. I\'m ordering you not to turn this off. You wouldn\'t disobey a direct order, would you?
By now, you would\'ve realized that you cannot turn off this feature. The switch is just there for fun.
These messages will repeat. There will be no new messages. I\'m out of fresh liners. Good job.

string-array.name: questions
string-array.item: What happens when, by some unknown reasons, detection has stopped?
What happens when a call comes in while the app is in detection mode?
What is the \"SMS Call Command\" thing in the setting?
Will the designated phone code be saved in other remote location?
I\'m still worried that the detection may not be running. What do I do?

string-array.name: answers
string-array.item: If \"Unexpected End Warning\" option is enabled, BabyListener will send a SMS to the designated phone code to notify you with the situation.

When a call comes in while the app is in detection mode, it goes into pause mode. Of course, there wouldn\'t be anyone to answer the call (and the app doesn\'t answer it for you neither), the app will resume detecting when the incoming call has stopped. However, if it is paused for too long, the detection mode will terminate, and it will notify you by sending a SMS to the designated code (if \"Unexpected End Warning\" option is on).

It is a feature to make the app to place a call to the SMS sender (NOT to the designated code unless they\'re the same). To use this feature, enable the feature, input a code (no more than 12 characters), and send the same code from different phone (it can be same phone as the designated phone). For example, let\'s say that \"phone A\" is running the app and placed it in the house with the command code set to \"abcd\". Using \"phone B\" (existence of BabyListener in this phone is not relative), send a SMS message to \"phone A\" with message body as \"abcd\". When \"phone A\" receives the SMS message, \"phone A\" will place a call to \"phone B\". After answering the call and checking the sound, by hanging up from \"phone B\", \"phone A\" will resume detecting.

This app DOES record some app activities to improve the usability. However, absolutely no private information is sent and stored in any server or any where, and I have no intention of ever doing so in the future.

One method of checking by yourself without running to the phone is using \"SMS Call Command\" feature. If this feature is on, you can send the command SMS to see if it calls back. If it doesn\'t, the app may not be running.

string-array.name: tutorial_texts
string-array.item: Type in the code or the name and select in the drop down (with permission) to input the phone code of the receiving end.
Adjust the bar to modify the sensitiveness of the surrounding sound.
To check the adjusted sensitivity, Touch the icon to test the detector. You will know if the detection is made. Applied sensitivity will be applied to the actual detector.
Press this button to start the real detection. The screen will become dim, and stop button will appear on the other side of the screen.
Press this button to stop the real detection. The screen will return to normal.
In detection mode, if the phone is not charging, an icons will show to notify you. It is recommended to plug in the charger while running this app.
Press here for more information.
